column4: is there a way to change permissions of a folder that is owned by root without using the terminal?
`gksu nautilus` will get you a root nautilus window.  Close it as soon as you're finished, and be extremely careful.
thanks; in that case I think I might as well use the terminal
You just shouldn't keep it open, andneed to be careful that you don't accidentally drag stuff places.  Simple mistakes like those are more common in a GUI (because chmod is hard to type as mv)
